1243606981002305536.text: As we first work to combat the public health emergency at hand, it’s important to keep families, businesses and the economy operating as normally as possible. This stabilization package is the third in a series of efforts to try and do just that, however more will be needed. 7/8

1243606979941146630.text: replenishing the Strategic National Stockpile, supporting federal, state and local public health agencies, grants for local school systems and higher education institutions, and assistance for child care. 6/8

1243606978829713414.text: At the same time, this package makes critical short- and long-term investments in the health care system including supplying additional personal protective equipment for our front line healthcare workers and first responders, 5/8

1243606977869230080.text: and creation of the Paycheck Protection Program which will forgive the portions of certain loans used to keep employees on payroll for up to eight weeks. 4/8

1243606976803864577.text: while providing other forms of relief such as suspending federal student loan payments for six months. It also provides additional relief to small businesses and their workers through the expansion of Small Business Administration lending programs 3/8

1243606975532982272.text: It gets money in people’s pockets quickly and expands unemployment insurance benefits to provide substantial relief over the next four months to help provide financial protection for millions of Americans 2/8

1243606972718604293.text: This package is focused on stabilizing our economy by providing additional critical support for our health care system, small businesses, state and local governments, workers and families. 1/8 #COVID19 https://t.co/f2ZWVlL0Yj
